bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, April 2, 1880

div1.p: Reed writes about lost dental tools. He comments on McPherson's scouting assignment and the resolution of a controversy concerning insubordination. He gives post news.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, April 2, 1880
div1.p:
It is certainly “high time”
that I was answering your letter, which
came a week ago. In the very outset,
my dear boy, let me urgently request that
you will examine into the depths of your
pannier, and see whether you find therein
an old dental case - a leather case
with an old gum lancet & a few pairs
of broken forceps &c- My reason for this
request is just this- Dr Oldmixon is re-
-sponsible for the case of rental instruments
& the Surgeon General is chasing him
all around the Country on the subject-
Oldmixon writes to me inquiring wheth-
-er he ever turned the case over to me
or not- which I am pretty sure that
he never did- However, old “it shall
be most excellent” says if they case
is anywhere “it shall be in the bottom
of that pannier which shall have Dr
McPherson”! Now, you have the whole
case in a “Nut-shell”- Let me hear
from you, at your earliest convenience
so that I may enable Oldmixon to
descend from the anxious stool, on which
his “carcass” now reposes- Well, my
dear Dorsey, I was grieved by your
last letter- on your own & my account-
on yours, that you will have to drag
your weary bones over the damnable
hills & gorges of our sister territory,
& on my own, that you will be kept
away so long from Apache- I do
hope that this expedition may forever
wind up old vic's hash! The confounded
Old “Son of a gun”! If you catch him
for the Lord's sake, kill him very dead!
It must be pleasant, though, to have, be-
side Gatewood & Tommy Lieut. Mills, an
old Apacheite -- I presume you must
occasionally enjoy sitting around the
camp fire & recalling events of other
scouts &c- Hesche! Mayhap, you would
like to know the result of Captains
Jack's whack at the fat K.O! well
it has resulted, sure enough! and
it seems that “Johannes”, the wonderfully
smart man that he thinks he is, was
just preparing a beautiful little
“boomerang”, which, returning to his
bosom, has dealt him a very savage
blow on his proboscis! Such a Sting-
ging, such a ringing, endorsement
I never read. The Dep't. Commander
tells old “Jack” that he has been keep-
-ing a “blackbook” (yes, Sir, black-
book!) on th his Commander Officer, a
fact which he tells him in plain language wont,
and unfortunately for Jack, it's true! He
also reminds him that he did not put
these charges against the K.O., until he,
(Jack) was called to order for a “dir-
iliction of duty on his own part!
After salting the old man, in the bri-
-niest vein, for a couple of pages,
the Dep't. Com. reminds him, that if he,
Jack, had had meantintended it for the good of the
service, he “would unquestionably have
preferred these charges as soon as
the offences were Committed”, & winds
up by requesting him to swallow
the following pleasant draught, 3
times a day, before meals, “The holding
in reserve charges against as a whip
with which to castigate a Commanding
Officer by a subordinate, is a practice
not encouraged by high-toned Army
Officers, nor approved of at these
Headquarters”! for all of which may
the good Lord be forever praised!
The result of this has been just what
might have been expected- the conceited
Mr Viven, has retired into his hole, with-
out so much as a growl! The bladder
has been pricked & the wind's all out!
Me thinks, the K.O. will now take delight
in daily sitting down on Johannes, the great.
There is no news at Apache- A rumor,
with the flavor of musty old age, floats
about the garrison to the effect, that
the 6th horse goeth to Oregon surely
this summer- Came all the way from the
Genl of the Army to the Col. of the 6th c-
you can deal it out to Gatewood & Tommy
for all it is worth- It may help them
to climb some rugged hill-side with
a lighter heart- Captain Hentig
returns shortly, but leaves Mrs. H. in
Frisco -- Mrs. Frank had a “kid,” one
week ago, a “gal kid,” & Frank is, by far,
the largest man in the Garrison! The K.O,
owing to Drunkeness on part of “patriots,”
has closed the bar indefinitely, & Lacy is
happy accordingly- With best love to Tommy, Mills
&Gatewood & an earnest hope that you will soon
return to my parental bosom,
